anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:03): I have a question :  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:03): Shindig assumes you already have a social network, that's to say, a site with:  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:03): - registered users --> yes  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:03): - a notion of "friends" between users --> no  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:03): - render customized pages for each user --> yes : user pages / all pages can be customized ?  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:03): - a way to send messages between users (useful, but not required) --> no  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:03): - a notion of an "activity stream" that lists actions that the friends of a given user have taken recently. --> smth like the Recent Chages on myxwiki  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:03): - a way to matched installed applications to corresponding users --> ?  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:04): So, I was trying to see how many of the requested things there are already on XWiki  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:04): and identify them  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 14:05): Could you help me with more info pls ?  
marta\_ - (11/05/2009 14:20): anamarias\_: 'a notion of "friends" between users' can be pretty easily implemented by defining an xwiki class and using xwiki objects attached to the user's page to express these relations  
marta\_ - (11/05/2009 14:21): 'render render customized pages for each user' is possible

glerouge - (11/05/2009 15:21): anamarias\_ re the activity stream, as marta\_ pointed it out you can pretty easily run a query to get all the latest modifications / activity done by an user and his / her friends. However that might not be the most effective appraoch when an user has many friends / a lot of activity (heavy queries running on the server)  
glerouge - (11/05/2009 15:22): anamarias\_ : an alternative would be to build upon XWiki's built-in activity stream service to create streams for each user  
rrodriguez left at 15:22 ()  
glerouge - (11/05/2009 15:22): then instead of running a query each time all you'd need to do would be to retrieve the user's stream

jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:36): anamarias\_: Hi  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:36): about the activitystream plugin,  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:36): it's a plugin that isn't bundled by default with XWiki Enterprise, it has to be installed manually  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:37): it's available here : http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Plugins/ActivityStreamPlugin  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 17:37): jvelociter: hi  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 17:38): it says you can record custom events too, nice  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:39): this is the API exposed by the plugin : http://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/~raw,r=9680/xwiki/xwiki-platform/xwiki-plugins/trunk/activitystream/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/activitystream/plugin/ActivityStreamPluginApi.java  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:39): it's also possible to extend the notification mecanism to recort custom events  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:39): I've done that in XWiki Workspaces for example  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:40): the specificity of activity event records is that they are not versionned, and they do not use XWiki's data model  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:41): it's a separate table in database  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:41): this allows to faster retrieve, and to not create a new version of the document for each activity event  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:42): here's the hibernate mapping http://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/~raw,r=9660/xwiki/xwiki-platform/xwiki-plugins/trunk/activitystream/src/main/resources/activitystream.hbm.xml  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:42): you can read all fields an activity event can have there  
jvelociter - (11/05/2009 17:42): most of them are not mandatory IIRC  
anamarias\_ - (11/05/2009 17:43): thanks this is very helpful
